column5: Back to the topic at hand. Muskie fishing does open tomorrow in many parts!! Cant wait!! Chuck and wind here we go!!
I'll be tryin' my luck on Jack Lake in Apsley. The weather doesn't look toooooo bad. A couple showers here and there but nothing us men can't handle.....right?!?! lol
Yeah... Cold front last night.....lol

Good luck to all who can get out to a zone that opens on the 1st Sat. in June. It should be an interesting opener given the weather over the past few months. Most importantly, play safe and have a good time.
Bass Pro Shops 100MPH is best IMO Paul, won't be cheap but you can't put a price on happiness
Sorry, thanks for stopping me
Well I know I will be throwing some Handlebarz on the Kawarthas.
Balsam and Cameron Lakes.
hoping that the thunderstorms stay away :S
Call me a wuss but I'm not taking my 14'er out in 3-4 foot waves all day  I can wait a weekend
Trout looks like it should be really good this weekend with all this rain.
Other then the fact that the rivers will be blown out with all the rain.

Change of plans, will be hitting the trent around Lindsay or Peterburough for musky and walleye (don't worry checked the regs more closely this time ) will be fishing from a canoe, anyone know if this is a good plan or should I do something else, would like to be east.
Musky opener this weekend  the weather isn't looking too great, looks like it could be windy and possible thunderstorms in zone 17  Where are you guys heading this weekend?
Trent River. Looks like I'll be bringing my rainsuit.
Pigeon lake. Looking forward to enjoying my Cabelas Guidewear Rainsuit that was 73% off last year!
I know that I'll be enjoying mine as well (heck of a sweet deal that was!) on Lake Travers.
Rideau, gonna have to get a good rain suit though.
I'm gonna have to wait until the 3rd Saturday to hit Nippissing...  Good luck to all you guys though.
Me too.  I have a lower end Helly Hansen suit that is not insulated, and gets pretty chilly underneath in the rain
Man, I missed a good deal!!!!!  Possibly Scugog targetting walleye as well as musky.
Doubt ill be getting out with whats forecasted, was planning on being out on LSC all day...  Bummer!
Rule #1 in muskie fishing...never complain about the weather,its when the bigs girls go.
In most of my musky pictures I am wearing a rain suit, or there are clouds in the sky.
Thanks Larry, I did not realize that
Fish are always wet... Dont know how many people ive said that to this week.
I'm pumped that the weather is gunna be wet...  It'll keep the damn pleasure boaters off the water...  Wakeboards Cruisers Speedboats  And hopefully a few less dedicated anglers will stay home...
I thought this was going to be like asking a Leprechaun where his pot of gold is!!! I've gotta say a little surprised over here..
Elora trout this weekend, gonna see if I can hit up some skis shore fishing this little inlet on the niagara next weekend. Should be great (first time musky fishing!)
Our plans were for LSC but family things are coming first. Good luck to everyone hitting the lakes this weekend.
You'd best wait a week...The Niagara(both Upper and Lower) does not open for Muskie till the 3rd Saturday in June!  Doesn't anyone read the regs?
Only calling for scattered clouds and rain on saturday?  You guys are wimps.
10-15mm where im going...  id say thats significant rainfall....  GO GUIDEWEAR   :thumbsup_anim:
Wrong, upstream of the falls it is zone 19, first Saturday. Also next week will be the second week in June not the third.
Your right read the regs from falls to peace bridge 3rd sat in june.  If your going to be a smart a$$ at least be right.
Times 2. Season closed!!!!

Read the exceptions...You're proof that we need to have a test to get your fishing license!  The poster I responded too made reference to fishing NEXT weekend, hence my comment about waiting a week...Hows that shoe taste?
Just quit while your ahead.
